definition: to compose (a piece of music)/(fig.) to create, by one's actions, a narrative (generally one that can be recounted with pride)

sentences.english: The Chinese side would like to work together with Arab states to compose a new chapter of China-Arab friendly cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 中方愿与阿方共同努力，谱写中阿友好合作的新篇章。

sentences.english: Phoenix patterns together with the other traditional patterns write a history of the Chinese patterns.
sentences.chinese: 凤纹样和其它传统纹样一起，共同谱写着中国纹样史。

sentences.english: With our practical action to write a song and a hymn in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 用我们实际行动来谱写一曲又一曲春天里的赞歌。

sentences.english: The song am composed by a youth stayer.
sentences.chinese: 这首歌是一位年青务工佣人谱写的。

sentences.english: Sincerely look forward to your cooperation, to co-creating a glorious future, and composing new writings.
sentences.chinese: 真诚期待和您的合作，共创美好未来，谱写新的篇章。

sentences.english: You will do much better starting a relationship with someone who has common interests.
sentences.chinese: 你会和有着共同兴趣的某人谱写一段更加浪漫的恋曲。

sentences.english: This musical composition was especially written by him for her.
sentences.chinese: 这支琴曲是他专门为她谱写的。

sentences.english: I can sign the preposition song in my sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我可以在我睡觉的时候谱写介词之歌。

sentences.english: Together, we will help write the next chapter of the great American story.
sentences.chinese: 让我们一起谱写美国历史新一页的华章。

sentences.english: The tune was composed at the beginning of the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 这支曲子是在解放战争初期谱写的。

sentences.english: The composition is in the manner of German folk songs.
sentences.chinese: 这首曲子是以德国民歌的风格谱写成的。

sentences.english: We are the architects of our own fate.
sentences.chinese: 命运都是由我们自己谱写的。

sentences.english: Of course, there are also part of the exotic marriage successfully wrote another.
sentences.chinese: 当然，也有一部分异国婚姻成功地谱写了别样的恋曲。

sentences.english: Music written in duple time for dancing the tango .
sentences.chinese: 为探戈谱写的一种双拍子乐曲。

sentences.english: Botou compose a long history of the development of China Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 泊头悠久的历史谱写出发展的华章。

definition: to express (emotions in prose)/a written description (of emotions)
lit. you can sing or you can cry (idiom); fig. deeply moving/happy and sad/inspiring and tragic
to sing the praises of/to extol/to eulogize
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote
hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
